channel.title: How to add ::Task command for Slayer Task [ PI ]
channel.description: On this one server I played they had a ::task command that teleported you to whatever your slayer task is, im just wondering how i could add the command into my commands.java... Someone please post the command for ::task if you have one, and if not, then please tell me how to do it! Thanks, Adam.

item.title: How to add ::Task command for Slayer Task [ PI ]
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:8, topic:519158”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=637617.msg4298079#msg4298079 date=1368554609]

We’re not going to do everything for you.
Here’s a good start:

if(playerCommand.startsWith("task")){
     switch(slayerTask){
          case 1:
               c.moveTo(XXXX, YYYY, H);
          break;
     }
}

Good luck.
[/quote]that’s a horrible way of doing it but for his level I guess probably the easiest

Well, I mean, it works fine. All slayer tasks either have a task ID or a monster ID. That’s the ID you’d use in the cases…
There is other ways to achieve this but do you really think a person with 0 Java knowledge would be able to pull that off?[/quote]true

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:10, topic:519158”]Dude I gave you the basics.[/quote]^ he gave you plenty to work from. If you have ERROR from building off of that feel free to ask. We are not a spoonfeeding community though.

Read full topic
item.source: How to add ::Task command for Slayer Task [ PI ]

We’re not going to do everything for you.
Here’s a good start:

if(playerCommand.startsWith("task")){
     switch(slayerTask){
          case 1:
               c.moveTo(XXXX, YYYY, H);
          break;
     }
}

Good luck.
[/quote]that’s a horrible way of doing it but for his level I guess probably the easiest :/[/quote]
Well, I mean, it works fine. All slayer tasks either have a task ID or a monster ID. That’s the ID you’d use in the cases…
There is other ways to achieve this but do you really think a person with 0 Java knowledge would be able to pull that off?

@adamgulka wrote:

Host Gushers:

your not gonna learn from copy pasting…He gave u a really good start.

You dont understand, i dont know a single thing about coding. i am new to this. all i am asking is a quick little copy and paste of the ::Task command so i can add it in… i know how to make that command so i teleport somewhere, but i dont know how to make it recognize the task and then teleport me to there…
